value: image:The River Stour at Sandwich, Kent - geograph.org.uk - 1584812.jpg

. The Earl of Sandwich is noted for the 'creation' of the sandwich snack.

Sandwich is one of the Cinque Ports, the five most important trading ports between that part of England and France.
There is a train station within the town.
Walk, although officially a town it is the size of a small village.

The 16th century Guild Hall.  Can you see which part is an extension from the 1960s?

The toll bridge

value: content=Situated to the north of Sandwich, the fort is in reality a collection of many phases of Roman remains that are still visible today and are under the auspices of English Heritage. The fort stands in the middle of an area thought to be the sight of the Claudian Invasion of 43AD. Described by English Heritage as 'perhaps the most symbolically important of all Roman sites in Britain'.

Walk along the "tow path" beside the river
